reviewText: This story highlights the critical problem in mental health law, of getting services to those who needs it but who are too mentally ill to know they need it. Sheriff Tom Dart shows his sensitivity to this problem at Cook County Jail in Illinois.

This program brings much needed attention to the situations of people with untreated mental illnesses. It explains how prisons became the new mental health institutions. I discuss this program in this article: http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/susan-inman/mental-illness-education_b_4133456.html After Her Brain Broke: Helping My Daughter Recover Her Sanity
